name: 林惠勇
objective:
本課程在介紹電腦視覺的基本概念與使用技術。課程內容包含: 1.introduction to computer vision 2.geometric camera calibration 3.illumination 4.geometry of multiple view 5.structure from motion 6.segmentation by clustering 7.tracking models 8.model-based vision 9.image-based rendering.
The goal of this course is to introduce the basic concepts and techniques of computer vision. The outline of this course includes: 1.introduction to computer vision 2.geometric camera calibration 3.illumination 4.geometry of multiple view 5.structure from motion 6.segmentation by clustering 7.tracking models 8.model-based vision 9.image-based rendering.
schedule:
Digital Image Formation	Image Geometry, Sampling and Quantization, Image Definition	3				
Optics, Digital Image Acquisition	Lens Equation, Image Resolution, Depth of Field, View Volume	6				
Image Manipulation	Image Filtering, Image Enhancement, Image Restoration in Spatial and Frequency Domain	9				
Binary Image Processing	Thresholding, Geometric Properties, Projections, Run-Length Encoding, Binary Algorithms, Morphologic Operators, OCR	9				
Region and Edges	Region Segmentation, Region Representation, Split and Merge, Region Growing	6				
Image Features	Gradient, Edge Detection, Corner Detection, Image Approximation, Subpixel Location Estimation, Edge Detector Performance	9				
Hough Transform, Ellipse Fitting	Hough Transform, Line Detection, Circle Fitting, Ellipse Fitting	6				
Active Contours	Active Contour Models	3				
Term Project Presentation	Student Term Project and Presentation			3
materials: E. Trucco and A. Verri, Introductory Techniques for 3-D Computer Vision, Prentice Hall, 1998.
